reviewText:
This is for the offline single-player RPG.

DISCLAIMER: I did not beat this game. I couldn't take any more grinding to get past the probably final dungeon, after the random encounter enemies were wiping me out despite being at level 50+ and having the best armor.

It's stock art, enemies and sound. RPGmaker stock stuff isn't bad but it shows a relative lack of effort. Major enemies and allies share sprites as well - I thought Samson had betrayed me or something but it was actually just some guy who was identical. The plot is relatively standard stuff: You, the sole capable fighter in the kingdom, must fight the entire army of darkness alone. Naked and armed with a long knife.

The main method of unlocking new towns and dungeons is mana collection. You collect mana by playing tag with angels inside of trees and caves. I'm not exaggerating, that's exactly what you do. You need to catch about 10 angels per dungeon (more or less, as the mana gain is randomized) while dodging enemies and going back to respawn the angels at a prayer point. It's pretty tedious.

There's a lot of grinding, but levels are useless aside from skill and HP/MP gain. Equipment is nearly the sole factor in victory or defeat. You also get only a pittance of money for each win. 'Sidequests' involve collecting a rare drop from enemies and turning it in repeatedly for a slightly better XP and cash gain.

The party system has some issues. The main character and his healer friend are permanent, leaving you with two spaces. The first three allies you unlock have the same class, equips and skills with only slightly different stat growths. The next three, halfway into the game, are a clone of the main character, a clone of the healer and a slightly different clone of the main character. There's also party switching. It's broken! If you do it wrong you can permanently lose a character, and even if you do it right your old and new characters lose all levels and gear! Why is this? Many games have figured out dynamic parties, it's not a new thing.

Item crafting is lame. First you have to grind enemies or certain respawning material points (similar to angels, but the ore doesn't run from you). It takes a good deal per item, and you need something like 2700 for a full set. Additionally, you're capped at 99 like every other item so you need to go back from time to time and drop them off. God forbid you pick up a chest full of the stuff without having  the space. The worst part of that is that after you collect the raw materials, you need to go 'refine' them. It takes five confirm presses to refine one item. There is no option for mass refinery. So if you want that end-game gear you'd better be ready to stand around and mash Z for a solid hour.

This may be a bug, but on-field enemies don't despawn. You can get caught in normal random battles, and flee or win as normal. But visible enemies pursue you and force you into a no-escape fight if they catch up. Even if you win, they don't go away - just take a step back (if they aren't blocked) and stop chasing you a while. God help you if you get caught in a hallway or have two enemies blocking you in a corner.

Pretty much the only thing this game has going for it is an active and interested creator. Overall I have no idea why you would pay $20 for this game! It might be good to kill ten hours if you got it for free. There are better RPGmaker games available.
voteText: 44 of 65 people (68%) found this review helpful 3 people found this review funny

Edited : This is version 1.0 i will try version 2.0 and update my review .

I have not finish the game yet but i want to give a short review .

I only play single player version

This game is like old classic JRPG style and i need a LOT of grinding to get through the game ( some really strong monsters that can kill me in one hit and some blocked areas that need grinding Mana to unlock) and many of expensive gears which make me want to grind grind grinding to get enough cash to buy them .

luckily i do love grinding in this game to get enough money to get items i want. ( sound like i am a shopaholic )

as well as get new strong magic when level up give me enough happiness that i can blow a pack of  strong monsters in one cast .

- no maps
- cannot exchange multiples Medal of Honor or Cristonia Nugget ( it need to keep pressing a button )
- F12 isn't screenshot but leave to main title ( please save often in case something gone wrong )

^_^ apart from that i like the game so far 8/10

the price is a little high in the UK but if you can get it on sale or cheap price then it is a must buy .

ps. i will update review when i beat the game.

reviewText:
Decent game, but has too many minor annoyances to recommend.

EDIT: I was wrong about this bit. Per dev comment you can indeed play full screen - I missed this.
As of writing this review, you cannot resize game window, it is very small, ~480x480. On a 4k or higher resolution screen this makes the game unplayably small.

The side quests in this game are ones where you turn in drops for rewards. You can get multiple of the same drop to turn in. But you have to turn them in one at a time, for no reason. When you have 100's to turn in you get annoyed part way through and just say sc*** it. Seriously, turn all of the same item in at once...

A number of the areas you go to are needlessly large. Ex: castles. I'm okay with the reusing of areas from one section of the game to another, but don't make them huge for no reason. The castle's are just a HUGE room with the entrance in the middle of one wall, and the king in the middle of the opposite wall. There is literally nothing else in this massive room. Nothing on the sides or anywhere else. Grandiose is nice, this isn't it.

Complaints aside, this game has the potential to be a fun nostalgia trip to the old 2D rpg days. Acceptable story.

reviewText:
I didn't play the mmo yet as I'm hooked on the RPG. Get it if you don't have it as I highly recommend it.

This is one of the best jrpgs I've  played and I've been playing rpgs since the first zelda and final fantasy on nintendo.

Story: Very well told and simple story. Nothing is dragged out and made more complicated than need be. The story doesn't choke you with narrative desperately trying to make it's point. The dialogue is brief but impactful when made.

Game Play: The gameplay is straight forward. Anyone who has played video games of any kind should get the mechanics down just fine. The combat skills really turn out pretty nice and each class has a unique way of contributing to the party.

Graphics: Nice, colorful and fantasy. What else do you want?

Fun Factor: One of the best rpgs I've played. Angels of Fasaria has that feel good" nostalgia of rpg's I've come to love from the past. If you like that old school "good wins"
date: "save the world from evil" type of fluff
recommended: then I can say that angels of fasaria has that and more.\n\nRe-play value: You start out with a static male character. You can not change that
hoursPlayed: he is the story but in spite of that the game is good enough to want to revisit years later. It has that classic feel.\n\nIf you played this game through to the end
voteText: I believe I speak for all of us when I say: WHEN WILL WE SEE THE SEQUEL? Why hasn't one been made yet?\n\nI believe that Angels of Fasaria stands above a simple score so I want provide one. I'm very well pleased."

reviewText: Angels of Fasaria 2.0 is a revised version of the original Angels of Fasaria, released in 2005. This new and improved version features a 2D RPG, trading cards and more. Visually it looks like an SNES RPG, and has a plot similar to something you would find in a final fantasy game. It brings back the nostalgic days of RPGing as a kid. There is also an online version, which I haven't tested, but this is for the single player RPG only. It's decently made for an indie game and a great remake of the classic.

reviewText:
The game is generic and a repetitive grind from the start.  Item crafting is nonsense.  The real issue though is the developer is extremely shady.  See that MMO tag?  Guess what, this game isn't an MMO, yet they advertise it as one.  The developers originally claimed that if you purchased the game, you would receive the MMO for free.  Now that doesn't seem to be the case anymore, as they clearly state the MMO will not be a free game.

The developer has supposedly started Alpha Testing their MMO, but in order to be considered to test, you have to buy THIS game first.  So, instead of creating a new game/MMO here on Steam and listing it as Early Access, they've taken signups to their own personal website and require that you buy this unrelated game first.  Seems like total bait to me.

Avoid this game.

reviewText: Product received for free\n\nThis game has no menus of any kind. No options, no video settings, no control settings, nothing. The game only runs in a tiny window, which is a problem on a large monitor with a high resolution. There is no way to view the controls either, I don't mind if the keys aren't rebindable although these days that is quite unacceptable, but not even having a single menu to view the key binds, and having to randomly hit your keys to figure out what does what, is definitely unacceptable. Then there are the video settings, by which i mean there are none, this is completely unacceptable. The worst games I have ever played in my life, all had options menus with even the bare bones of configurable settings. Make some menus, at the very bare minimum add a menu to view the keybinds, and a video options menu to change the window size.

Make some menus, at the very bare minimum add a menu to view the keybinds, and a video options menu to change the window size.
voteText: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Played the Browser game for Angels of Fasaria a long while ago and it was amazing.  Played a little of this game while it was in development and loved it as well.

Angels of Fasaria RPG (Single Player) has that old school RPG feel to it and has a decent story.  It's a lot of fun. The problem is that it is a very short lived adventure.

MMORPG - a seperate game, but comes as part of the package is not even remotely close to being fun.  It is extremely rough to get started as you struggle to beat any creatures at level 1. It is also a MAJOR grindfest when it comes to leveling.  On top of that, it's an even BIGGER grindfest to get currency to get gear.  The game is an amatuer project and came after the production of the single player game years ago.  How it ended up being so much worse is crazy.

Thywill, the sole developer of these games, does also bribe purchasers to give postive reviews through private messages here on Steam.  So take a really close look at the quality of the reviews of those who are giving this a thumbs up for recommendation.  Anyone without detailed comments about the game are most likely bribed reviewers seeking moderator positions in one of Thywill's games or a position on private forums for these games.
voteText: 25 of 52 people (48%) found this review helpful 4 people found this review funny

reviewText: What is it about RPG Maker that makes the world's worst writers congregate to it?
voteText: 17 of 36 people (47%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
My first 5 minutes:
Why isn't the controller responding? Ah, cursor keys work... wait.. X instead of A button? Back to controller.
Found armor that I can't equip.... in my room, for females. Cloud?!
This castle only got 3 areas and the kings aides are shopkeepers? Wait, I got NO armor on? Its over 100 $ ?
So, outside the castle has architecture as weird as inside.
Oh random encounter..
3 enemies? Woah, they hit for almost 20 % of my health!
I don't have any skills?
Run back inside to heal after winning, at least my bed is free.
Can't afford armor yet, thats still over 100 $ away.
Fiddlesticks... random encounter, barely survied, a disgraced NPC with bad story explanation directly in front of the castle and moving dogs that ALSO trigger fights... that surrounded me by randomly walking while the npc keeps talking.
Dead.

I don't mind hard, some of my favourite games on steam have permadeath. This isn't hard, it's unbalanced.
If you are a fan you might want it. Otherwise there are other games on steam that are more fun in the same price range.
voteText: 63 of 132 people (48%) found this review helpful 6 people found this review funny

reviewText:
I just can't stand another bland jrpg made in some kind of a RPG maker program. Looking at this game makes me want to delete it.

Just look at the trailer. For 14,99 Euros as Steam is currently showing (as of 11th of November 2015) you can definitively get a better game. Maybe Dragon Age or Mass Effect? I believe you can see the difference.

----------
For anyone interested in joining in on completing your own backlog; check it out here - http://steamcommunity.com/groups/completingthebacklog/discussions/5/530645446320364338/

reviewText: I don't even know where to begin with how bad this game is.\nPlease do not buy it. Burning your money in a hole would be a wiser use of your resources.
voteText: 9 of 28 people (32%) found this review helpful 2 people found this review funny

reviewText: I was expecting to see the Online version of this game, but unable too play it and cannot figure out how to. It is a waste of money and time. Plz get rid of it if not working at all.
voteText: 13 of 45 people (29%) found this review helpful

reviewText: I was looking forward and had great expectations for this game, I was utterly disappointed.The most annoying aspects were the battles, you were minding your own business walking on the map and suddenly a battle breaks loose, with no warning, you couldn't see any beasts on the map before you were forced into battle so you were not prepared.Also a idiotic feature, the waste of space houses and endless roads, everything was repetitive and boring. I tried to like it but it gave me no chance.My eagerness for exploration was utterly smashed by my frustration with those endless boooring battles out of the blue. I could continue to state why I dislike this game, anyway if you want a decent 2D RPG I recommend visiting Aveyond Kindom, I played a lot of their games and not once was I this disappointed.
voteText: 20 of 87 people (23%) found this review helpful 9 people found this review funny

reviewText:
A mediocre and boring RPG.

The developer is overzealous about policing the reviews, often dismissing legitimate concerns as trolling" or flagging the review as off-topic. The recent steam review overhaul seems to have removed the erroneous flags however.

I get it
date: it's tough to take criticism about something you created
recommended: but this type of behavior is not doing you any favors. Just let the negative reviews be."
